text: Percy Francis Hobson (5 November 1942 â€“ 4 January 2022) was an Australian high jumper. He won the men's event at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Perth. He was the first Indigenous Australian to earn a gold medal at the Commonwealth Games. He was born in Bourke, New South Wales. Hobson died in Melbourne, Victoria, on 4 January 2022. He was 79. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Australian athletes Category:High jumpers Category:Commonwealth Games medallists Category:Indigenous Australian sportspeople Category:Sportspeople from New South Wales
title: Percy Hobson (high jumper)
